channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: Car dealerships are being disrupted by a multi-day outage after cyberattacks on software supplier
item.description: Car dealerships across North America have faced a major disruption this week

item.title: FOUND: Missing boy near Huntington Lake safe
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Gold's price is up by more than 14% in 2024. Here are 6 reasons to buy in now.
item.description: Gold's price has climbed over 14% this year and more growth could be ahead. Here's why you should buy in now.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Gun control groups hail Supreme Court decision upholding gun ban for domestic abusers
item.description: The Supreme Court's 8-1 decision to restrict firearms to people with domestic violence restraining orders is seen by many as a common sense method to curbing shootings.

item.title: Greece heatwave latest: New fire ‘every ten minutes’ amid hunt for arsonist and search for missing American
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Amazon to stop using plastic air pillows in packages
item.description: Amazon said customers will notice that the air pillows are missing from the orders starting in July.

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Steve Bannon files appeal to Supreme Court in bid to stay out of jail
item.description: Bannon was ordered to surrender to prison by July 1 to serve his four-month sentence for a contempt of Congress conviction.

item.title: Truck driver arrested after fatal crash on I-380
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (June 23)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the 2023 News & Documentary Emmy-winner for Outstanding Recorded News Program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: 2 years after pushing back Russia, Kharkiv faces barrage of attacks
item.description: Two years after Ukraine pushed back Russian forces, Kharkiv is facing a barrage of attacks.

item.title: Giving Slovak jets, air defence to Kyiv was sabotage, new government says
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: The sometimes dark history of ice cream trucks in America
item.description: While ice cream bars and trucks have been childhood staples for more than 100 years, not all of the history has been sweet. Museum of Ice Cream co-founder and co-CEO Manish Vora joined CBS News to discuss the somewhat unknown history of ice cream and ice cream trucks.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: Boston set for parade to salute Celtics' record 18th NBA championship
item.description: The Celtics entered the season vowing to turn recent their heartbreaks into happiness

item.title: 1 killed, 1 airlifted, 4 evaluated in crash involving tractor-trailers on I-485 in NE Charlotte
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: New York prosecutors ask judge to keep Trump gag order in place
item.description: Prosecutors told Justice Juan Merchan in a filing released Friday that the order is needed to shield jurors, attorneys and staffers from threats.
